intro: Navarretia linearifolia subsp. linearifolia, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and northern Baja California. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as hillsides and coastal areas. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing numerous tiny flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. This subspecies is often found in serpentine soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
